name: Bilateral Trigeminal-Trochlear Synkinesis
chief_complaint: Involuntary eye movements and facial twitching when chewing
symptoms: Synchronous jaw clenching with upward eye deviation
physical_findings: Aberrant trigeminal nerve enhancement on MRI
Trochlear nerve hyperintensity on CISS sequences
treatment: Botulinum toxin injections to affected muscles
prognosis: Guarded - 60% achieve partial symptom control with combination therapy
description: A rare cranial nerve synkinesis where trigeminal nerve activation abnormally stimulates the trochlear nerve, causing simultaneous masticatory muscle contraction and superior oblique activation. Believed to result from aberrant axonal regeneration post-subclinical viral neuritis.
